description: This hearty lamb and rosemary shepherd’s pie with parsnip mash is perfect to enjoy on cooler days. Plus, it’s full of delicious veg.
keywords: Shepherd's & cottage pie,Low saturated fat,Fresh ingredients,Tree nut free,Lamb,Egg free,Winter,Low sugar,Sesame free,Potato,High protein,Parsnip,Comfort food,Mince,Peanut free
name: Shepherd's Pie With Parsnip Mash Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 300g white washed potatoes, peeled, cut into 6cm chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large heavy-based saucepan over high heat. Add mince and cook, breaking up lumps, for 6 minutes or until well browned. Transfer to a bowl.

Reduce heat to medium. Add onion, carrot and celery to pan and cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Add garlic and chopped rosemary and cook for 1 minute. Return mince to pan. Stir in tomato paste, flour and Worcestershire sauce and cook for a further 1 minute. Add stock and lentils. Bring to a simmer and cook for 25 minutes, stirring, or until lentils soften and sauce thickens.

Meanwhile, to make the mash, place parsnip and potato in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return to pan with milk. Mash and season.

Preheat grill on high. Place a 10-cup capacity pie dish on an oven tray (to catch spills). Spoon mince mixture into dish. Top with mash and cheese. Grill for 6 minutes or until cheese is golden. Serve topped with extra rosemary.
